name: Elizabeth Shahid
text: Leaving out information to create a false narrative is not “news”.

name: Charles Bryant
text: Shame on Birmingham News! I've repeatedly fell for the subscription scam with your paper. When I tell you I've NEVER received a paper, you try to "workout" delivery issues to no avail. You have no problems to continue to charge my account and today I've had it! Today, I spoke to a nice young man named Blessing who stated that he will stop the recurring charges. Since we've been down this road before, I want to warn others DON'T get a subscription or fall for this scam! I will contact the local consumer reporters on all of the news stations if you continue to charge me. I am sure we aren't the only ones being scammed; look at past posts.

name: James Lawley
text: We are witnessing the media at it's lowest point in history. AL.com is leading the way. No credibility or integrity. Just alot of bias, speculation and sensationalism. While I believe there to be hope, I am confident you have not yet reached bottom.

name: Brad Bray
text:
BEWARE of SCAM! Please use another company unless you enjoy losing large amounts of money with nothing in return.

These people will do and say whatever it takes to get you in a contract, and they never deliver, they promise you the moon and nobody has a clue what's going on in this pathetic organization.

I'll say it again loud and clear, DO NOT USE AL MEDIA GROUP!

name: cecilia black
text: Thank You Alabama Media Group, for all the obituaries Alabama Media Group writes and prints. There are so many people we want to keep up with, however throughout the years we seem to loose touch. The diligent  work the Alabama Media Group in Birmingham, helps us to keep up with people have deceased and allow us to keep in touch with the families of the deceased people and allow us to be able to share condolences.

name: Aguy Whoisnthappy
text: AVOID! Potential Advertisers Beware! Certain sales personnel are dishonest and attempt to lock you into contracts with terms you did not agree to. Beware horrendous charges and a general lack of integrity with this company. I don't want anyone else to fall victim to the same scams they roped us into.

name: Shannon Moore
text: Calling the number does no good. No one answers and the extensions do not work. I am so f****** tired of these people throwing litter in my driveway. The next time I see the guy throwing newspapers I'm going to throw it right back at him. I didn't sign up for it I don't want it stop littering in my front yard

name: dick frost
text: Buses are unreliable

name: Mechelle Ellis
text: Cool

name: Elenana Burton
text: This place was so cute and beautiful low lit with hundreds of candles. It was set in a garden like setting, very romantic. Great way to celebrate 3 years with my love. There was a live artist painting on the spot. We both had meat plates, very good sized and full of awesome, delicious spiced flavors. This place was magical .

resp.text: Thank you for the review Elenana, but you must have us confused with something else. We're a community news and information website.

name: Boris The Blade
text: Dont like them

name: John Mason-Smith
text: The OBA Community Website has their fingers on the pulse of the Orange Beach and surrounding community area. From land, sea, and air, if it's in the OBA find it here.

name: Gail Cole
text:
The OBA Community Website is very informative for both locals and visitors.
Local news, events and relative information pertinent to anyone visiting our beautiful beaches is all in one place.
You can always stay up to date with everything on the island by visiting the OBA Community Website.

name: Skie Brown
text: The first place to look when you’re wanting information for anywhere along the Alabama/ Florida gulf coast! Where to eat, beach and weather updates, local  happenings. New ( and old) places to explore, local music coverage.. it covers absolutely  everything.  ❤️🌴😎

name: Michael Thomas
text: Best site in Lower Alabama for information and happenings in the Orange Beach and Gulf Shores area. Awesome pictures and reviews are also one of the key features of this site. Best Local source site around! Visit often!

name: Brenda Kennedy
text: Great site!  I highly recommend this!  It is a good source for knowing all about Orange Beach and surrounding areas.  Always right on topics as well.

name: David Lindley
text: This is the most informative website you can find. You can find everything you need to know on this site not only for visitors but for locals as well. Info on everything from restaurants to local events. And always current!

name: Ben Taylor
text: Awesome organization all around! They don’t post garbage for some kind of popularity contest, but rather to inform those who truly appreciate the area and want to know what the locals know

name: Debi Hartley
text: Very good site for getting updates/info about this beautiful place. Going to visit? Want to know what's going on...where to go or stay? Check here!!

name: Karen Peacock
text: This is one of the best go - to websites for news, weather, photography, etc....    It's a must if you love the gulf coast beaches, and all of the Orange Beach, Gulf Shores area.   If you live here full time, 2nd home here, or just love vacationing or visiting here, you will love this website, along with the OBA Community Facebook page.

name: BRENT WILLIAMS
text: This website help keep my wife and myself aware of events and news for the area.  It is essential reading!

name: T Patterson
text: This is most definitely THE place to find out all that is happening in the Orange Beach and surrounding areas.  You can ask questions and ask for recommendations and get some valuable information.

name: Capt Gary
text:
The best website for all things in the Orange Beach, Gulf Shores, Ft. Morgan, Alabama and Perdido Key and Pensacola, Fl..
As well as Weather and Braking National News...

name: Michele Crandall
text: I no longer live in the area but group near there.....I enjoy being able to keep up with what's happening & LOVE the pics!

name: Randall Horden
text: Very community minded website with local talent keeping it current, super helpful when wondering what's happening or considering a visit to Orange Beach.

name: Randy “Randav27” Davila
text: So It's automatically assumed I am apart of some cyber bully agenda because I left an honest opinion of your organization that doesn't benefit you?  If you can't take negative reviews, I would suggest a different line of business.  Proper PR would not just point fingers.

resp.text:
Randy is part of a cyber-bullying group upset that we posted this... https://www.facebook.com/OBAWebsite/posts/10156615405356738

Because of Randy's fake review this posts is getting more attention.

name: Kay Moody
text: Excellent sight for locals and visitors to find out what's going on in our neighborhood.  Rely heavily on the for OUR Blue Angels updates.

name: Sugarcane Jane
text: Everything you want to know about Orange Beach as well as everything you didn’t know you “wanted to know”. Amazing images and information about our beautiful community of Orange Beach, Alabama.

name: Jan comstock
text: Incredible resource for locals and tourists alike.  OBA Community Website has everything you need to know about Orange Beach, Gulf Shores, Fort Morgan, Perdido Key and beyond.

name: Kathy Tanner
text: All the information you need about Orange Beach and surrounding areas in this website. Dining, fishing, events and where to find shells it has it all.

name: Laura Collins
text: The OBA community is the best source for all the facts and fun around Orange Beach! Love this site and all the wonderful people in this OBA community!

name: Michelle Brown
text: Great page!!!  Great souce of local information and beautoful scenery.

name: Josias Rivera
text: Very unprofessional. Do not recommend. And I’m far from a cyber bully. Just can’t stand people who misinform others and have no clue besides what they’re own emotions and agenda allow. What does a community website possibly know about helicopters? Exactly. Unprofessional.

resp.text:
J﻿osias is part of a cyber-bullying group upset that we posted this... https://www.facebook.com/OBAWebsite/posts/10156615405356738

name: tim knight
text: Great website and very helpful in following events and happenings in OBA.  Thanks for sharing!

name: Gary Berdeaux
text: A great site and valued community resource!  Thanks Ken!

name: Daniel Cooper
text: Excellent news, event notifications and tourism ideas with a nice balance of quality advertising!

name: Runyan and Associates
text: If you're visiting or living on the beautiful beaches of Gulf Shores and Orange Beach Alabama the OBA website is a must. Pertinent and relative content all the time, enjoy.

name: Judi Wheat
text: Love the OBA Community Website for local information.  I live in Elberta and appreciate their covering events and news from all the area.

text: My wife and I enjoy listening to the Friday night football games as well. But all in all this is a heck of a station. I give you 2 thumbs up!

text: This is good radio. I'm more into the 80's pop stuff and it seems there is about 30 percent pop from the 80's. If you are looking for a good station this is it

name: Shawn Maze
text: Best station in North Alabama. What can I say? I love the music! I would choose this as my playlist

name: Ronald Lynch
text: Good Quality Radio with mostly music. Not that much talk radio. Be sure and check it out on Friday Nights during Football Season. They normally play Alabama Football on Saturdays too.

name: William Rutherford
text: This is my drive home station. And we love the updates, news, and morning shows as well. But our Favorite is Adam. He's the man!

name: Thomas Weiss

name: Cynthia Cowart
text: What your station advertised on the issue of The Mobile County School Buses was very much uncalled for,,, NO CAMERAS ON THE BUSES,,, You put a lot of School Drivers & Children is harms way. You are basically telling the public to run a stopped bus ,,, GOOD CALL,,,, Our Bus Drivers & Children are in danger everyday ,, Due to the fact the public does not respect these drivers,,, Look at the accident that occurred due to a speedy driver which caused the life of a Bus Driver. Insure I speak for a lot of the public . Your station along with the other ones need to retract your stories ,,, as WELL AS NOT PUTTING SUCH ON TV

text: Worst channel. We don't need an hourly review of rain. Thanks for ruining the race My family has banned this channel.

name: Kaquandria Johnson
text: In my opinion Fox 10 is accurate and informative....I called to get the email address to send my son 1st day of school pic...It was so early in the morning...the operator forwarded me to the correct and the both of their attitudes was awesome and professional..

name: C W
text: If you spent less time repeating the same stories over & over, then you could have saluted all the seniors that were sent in. Therefore, I'm done with fox 10 news!

name: Lord Benson
text: God forbid we actually get a hurricane in the Gulf. We're having a rain event with wind gusting at little more than a windy day at the beach. Please chicken little stop interrupting the race. Have you guys ever heard of the saying"don't making a mountain out of a molehill"? You're guilty !
